data.text: @TheTalkCBS The average mother does get sent home too soon due to insurance policy.  Royalty has everything at the palace, individualized care and pampering for her, her baby and her other children.  Her presence at the hospital would have been disruptive to staff and other new parents.
@TheTalkCBS Yes. I gave birth to my second son, without an epidural, I was ready to go home. I was able to walk soon after birth.
@TheTalkCBS we been doing it since we were bought over here
@TheTalkCBS Congratulations on the new arrival.
@TheTalkCBS Yes
@TheTalkCBS Yes, but she has a ton of help !!
@TheTalkCBS yes
@TheTalkCBS I wanted out of the hospital ASAP. Way more relaxing at home!
@TheTalkCBS Yes but she looks great and all that matters is that she and the family is doing well and that they are healthy

@TheTalkCBS These days every woman goes home the same day after birth! They act like it is a great feat! Give me a break. I delivered my son in 45 minutes with no drugs at 4 in the morning, and was home by the afternoon! And this was 38 years ago! She's a roya not mother Mary.
@TheTalkCBS I always tried to leave the hospital as soon as possible. They make you stay 24 hours in BC but with my 3rd child I probably could have gone home within 8 hours.
@TheTalkCBS Absolutely.  The baby, at least, should stay in the hospital a couple of days as there are some problems that won't show up in a baby for a couple of days.
@TheTalkCBS Too much pressure to be perfect.

@TheTalkCBS I think women need to be more empowered to listen to THEIR INDIVIDUAL bodies, not group mentality. I happened to recover more quickly like Kate, but there are many that need more time and BOTH are okay! #forallmoms
@TheTalkCBS She looks amazing but she should do - she no doubt had a stylist making sure she did. I so hope she has gone home and put on some comfy pjs and slippers!
@TheTalkCBS It’s alright for the mom to leave the Hospital it’s the Baby who needs more time in the Hospital, they sometimes get Jaundice or other ailments that don’t show up for a day or two
@TheTalkCBS Yes they do! #EverybodyTalks

@TheTalkCBS Nope. Fifty five years ago, my mom went to a clinic and had my baby brother & came home and cooked breakfast for five other kids and dad. Having a baby isn't life threatening surgery. But pampering goes a long way..
@TheTalkCBS No but I will say this. Three c sections and I just wanted to go home as fast as I could
@TheTalkCBS Of Course We Do
@TheTalkCBS she is royalty she is princess so she is not the same as regular people
@TheTalkCBS With my 4th I was pacing the halls in a few hours and couldn't wait to get him home. I'm certain if there are any issues with the little one they have access to imnediate care.
@TheTalkCBS Not for her. I'm sure she went home to better care than the hospitals provide.
@TheTalkCBS Yes. The insurance/ hospitals are encouraged to discharge asap. So many women feel pressured to resume normal activities pretty quickly.
@TheTalkCBS Well, we forget the  doctors and nurses they have at home..in case of emergency. Home is the best place to recover and bond with family. 😁
@TheTalkCBS I'm sorry, I don't normally watch this show, but WHY does Sharon Osborne comment first and then blather on and on and never give anyone else a chance to "talk"???!!!
@TheTalkCBS Nope. Women used to have babies at home and then wash a load of laundry.
@TheTalkCBS I wouldn't wear high heels after giving birth so soon. I'd wear flat heels.
@TheTalkCBS I believe she does because she's royalty.
@TheTalkCBS No,  if anything they are forced to take it easy.
@TheTalkCBS No . how long it takes a mother to bounce back depends on how well they took care of themselves before and during their pregnancy.#EverybodyTalks

@TheTalkCBS And this is a conversation why?! I can think of so many more IMPORTANT issues that could be discussed than HER choice. This is why talk shows have become nothing more than a gossip tell all. They used to discuss real issues once upon a time... 🤷‍♀️
@TheTalkCBS No. I was up walking around and organizing his baby clothes at the hospital right after my son was born #EverybodyTalks
@TheTalkCBS She probley has great medical care for her and baby at home everyday women don't.
@TheTalkCBS Congratulations to the Royal Family
@TheTalkCBS I don’t think she left for any other reason than to recover at home with her family. Hospitals are horrible places to be when you are not “sick.”
@TheTalkCBS Yes. But in her case she has people at home to care for her.

@TheTalkCBS You can’t compare her situation to a normal person. She is royalty is expected to make this appearance with the baby. Also she is going home to a palace with a team of people to help her recover. Seeing this should not put pressure anyone, go at your own pace.

@TheTalkCBS Kate probably has more help at home than at the hospital. For the rest of us commoners: totally think we are shamed to get up and get going rather than just bond with our baby. https://t.co/63HjRzP3hW

@TheTalkCBS She looks wonderful, but she has a lot of help waiting for her and the baby. In this case, I suspect security for the family is a huge consideration. They are safer at home and she was obviously well enough to return. Congratulations to them. They are good parents!!!
@TheTalkCBS Congrats y'all much love love u all
